headline: Home Depot Resets Office Workforce While Betting On Tech And Garden Growth
summary: Home Depot (NYSE:HD) is cutting several hundred corporate roles and requiring full-time office attendance. The company is expanding its retail offering with new tech tools for professionals and sustainable product partnerships. Home Depot will be a key U.S. retailer for wire-free robotic lawn mowers as these products roll out nationally. For investors watching NYSE:HD at around $387.2, these moves sit against a mixed return profile. The stock is up 12.0% year to date, 12.5% over the past 30...
